p: Thioesters have been also detected in thermally not processed unkilned hops, suggesting that they are naturally occurring components of hop essential oils, although present in lower concentrations than after heat processing that causes their additional formation [ 142]. A study of Guadagni and coworkers [ 143], on the odor contributions of 25 main chemical components of hop essential oils from Bullion hops, has allocated S-methyl hexanethioate on the second place regarding its contribution (4â€“8%) to the hop aroma. Moreover, S-methylthiomethyl thioesters have been uniquely found in hops [ 142].
